general_advice.tempo: Control both lifting and lowering phases; avoid jerky movements
general_advice.range_of_motion: Use full range of motion unless limited by mobility or injury
general_advice.breathing: Exhale during exertion (the hard part), inhale during the return
general_advice.progression: Master proper form with lighter weights before adding load
general_advice.warmup: Perform warm-up sets before working sets on compound movements
general_advice.safety: Weight training has substantially lower injury rates than contact sports; proper form and periodization further reduce risk (Stone 1990, Zemper 1990)

exercises.name: Push-up
exercises.description: A fundamental bodyweight exercise that targets the chest, triceps, and shoulders
instructions: Place hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, fingers forward
Lower chest to the floor by bending elbows
Press back up until arms are straight
tips: Keep elbows at 45 degrees to your torso, not flared out
Maintain a rigid plank from head to heels
Touch chest to floor for full depth
avoid: Sagging hips or piking butt up
Leading with your head instead of chest

exercises.name: Diamond push-up
exercises.description: A push-up variation with hands close together, emphasizing the inner chest and triceps
instructions: Place hands together under your chest, forming a diamond shape
Lower chest toward your hands by bending elbows
Press back up until arms are straight
tips: Keep elbows tracking along your sides
Touch your chest to your hands at the bottom
Squeeze triceps hard at the top
avoid: Flaring elbows wide (defeats tricep emphasis)
Placing hands too far forward of your chest

exercises.name: Resistance band chest press
exercises.description: A chest press using resistance bands for portable strength training
instructions: Anchor band at chest height or wrap around your back
Hold handles at chest level with elbows bent
Press arms forward until extended
Return to start, keeping tension in the band
tips: Squeeze shoulder blades together at the start
Keep shoulders down, away from ears
Feel the chest stretch as you return
avoid: Letting the band go slack between reps
Shrugging shoulders toward ears during the press

exercises.name: Resistance band fly
exercises.description: An isolation exercise for the chest using resistance bands
instructions: Anchor band behind you at chest height
Extend arms to sides with a slight elbow bend
Bring hands together in front of chest in a hugging motion
Return to start with arms wide
tips: Keep the same slight elbow bend throughout
Squeeze chest hard when hands meet
Think about pushing with your inner chest
avoid: Straightening arms completely (stresses elbows)
Bending elbows more as you bring hands together

exercises.name: Dumbbell bench press
exercises.description: A classic chest exercise using dumbbells for balanced strength development
instructions: Lie on bench with dumbbells at chest level, feet flat on floor
Press dumbbells up until arms are extended
Lower until upper arms are parallel to floor or slightly below
Press back up to start
tips: Keep wrists stacked over elbows throughout
Squeeze shoulder blades into the bench
Drive dumbbells slightly together at the top
avoid: Bouncing weights off chest to start the press
Letting dumbbells drift toward your face or belly

exercises.name: Dumbbell fly
exercises.description: An isolation exercise that stretches and contracts the chest muscles
instructions: Lie on bench with dumbbells above chest, palms facing each other
Lower dumbbells out to sides with a slight elbow bend
Stop when you feel a deep chest stretch
Squeeze chest to bring dumbbells back together
tips: Imagine hugging a large tree
Keep the same elbow angle throughout
Focus on squeezing the chest, not the arms
avoid: Lowering weights below shoulder level (strains shoulders)
Turning the fly into a press by bending elbows more

exercises.name: Incline dumbbell press
exercises.description: A press on an inclined bench targeting the upper chest
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline
Hold dumbbells at shoulder level, elbows out
Press up until arms are extended
Lower to shoulder level
tips: Plant feet firmly and drive through them
Keep shoulder blades pinched together
Feel the upper chest doing the work
avoid: Setting incline above 45 degrees (becomes shoulder press)
Letting lower back arch off the bench

exercises.name: Barbell bench press
exercises.description: The classic compound exercise for building chest strength and mass
instructions: Lie on bench with eyes under the bar
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Unrack and lower bar to mid-chest
Press bar up until arms lock out
tips: Squeeze shoulder blades together and down
Touch the same spot on chest every rep
Drive feet into floor for leg drive
avoid: Bouncing bar off chest
Flaring elbows straight out to 90 degrees

exercises.name: Incline barbell press
exercises.description: An incline pressing movement emphasizing the upper chest
instructions: Set bench to 30-45 degree incline in rack
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulder-width
Unrack and lower bar to upper chest near clavicle
Press bar up until arms lock out
tips: Keep shoulder blades retracted throughout
Feel the stretch in upper chest at bottom
Bar path should be slightly diagonal, not vertical
avoid: Lowering bar to lower chest (misses upper chest)
Setting incline too steep (becomes shoulder press)

exercises.name: Machine chest press
exercises.description: A machine-based chest press providing guided movement and stability
instructions: Adjust seat so handles are at chest level
Grip handles and press forward until arms extend
Squeeze chest at full extension
Return handles to start position
tips: Keep back flat against the pad
Feel the stretch in chest at the start position
Push with your chest, not just your arms
avoid: Seat too high (shoulders work more than chest)
Seat too low (strains shoulder joint)

exercises.name: Cable fly
exercises.description: A cable-based fly providing constant tension throughout the movement
instructions: Set pulleys at shoulder height or higher
Step forward with arms extended to sides, slight elbow bend
Bring hands together in front of chest
Return to start with arms wide
tips: Keep elbow angle fixed throughout
Squeeze chest hard when hands meet
Stagger stance for stability (one foot forward)
avoid: Bending elbows more as you squeeze (becomes a press)
Letting cables pull you backward

exercises.name: Pull-up
exercises.description: A fundamental upper body pulling exercise using body weight
instructions: Hang from bar with palms facing away, hands wider than shoulders
Pull yourself up until chin clears the bar
Lower with control to full arm extension
tips: Initiate by pulling shoulder blades down and back
Think about driving elbows down toward your hips
Squeeze lats hard at the top
avoid: Shrugging shoulders up toward ears during the pull
Kicking legs or using body momentum

exercises.name: Chin-up
exercises.description: A pull-up variation with underhand grip emphasizing biceps involvement
instructions: Hang from bar with palms facing you, hands shoulder-width apart
Pull yourself up until chin clears the bar
Lower with control to full arm extension
tips: Lead with your chest, not your chin
Keep elbows pointing forward throughout the pull
Squeeze biceps and lats together at the top
avoid: Shrugging shoulders up at the bottom of the hang
Craning neck forward to clear the bar

exercises.name: Inverted row
exercises.description: A horizontal pulling exercise using body weight on a low bar or suspension trainer
instructions: Set a bar at waist height; hang underneath with heels on ground
Pull your chest to the bar by driving elbows back
Lower until arms are fully extended
tips: Keep your body rigid from ankles to shoulders
Initiate by retracting shoulder blades before bending arms
Touch the same spot on your chest each rep
avoid: Letting hips sag or pike during the movement
Leading with chin instead of chest

exercises.name: Resistance band row
exercises.description: A rowing exercise using resistance bands for back development
instructions: Anchor band at chest height; hold handles with arms extended
Pull elbows back until hands reach your ribs
Return to start under tension
tips: Pause and squeeze shoulder blades together at peak contraction
Keep elbows close to your body throughout
Stand far enough back to maintain band tension at the start
avoid: Letting the band snap back uncontrolled
Shrugging shoulders up toward ears

exercises.name: Resistance band lat pulldown
exercises.description: A vertical pulling movement using bands to target the lats
instructions: Anchor band overhead; kneel or stand gripping the band
Pull down until hands reach shoulder level, elbows to sides
Return overhead with control
tips: Initiate by depressing shoulder blades before pulling
Think about driving elbows into your back pockets
Lean torso back slightly to create a better pull angle
avoid: Flaring elbows out wide during the pull
Letting shoulders shrug up as you return to start

exercises.name: Dumbbell row
exercises.description: A unilateral rowing exercise for building back thickness
instructions: Place one hand and knee on a bench; hold dumbbell in opposite hand
Pull the dumbbell up until it reaches your hip
Lower until arm is fully extended
tips: Row toward your hip, not your armpit
Keep your back flat and parallel to the floor
Let shoulder blade protract at the bottom for full stretch
avoid: Rotating torso to heave the weight up
Cutting the rep short at the top

exercises.name: Dumbbell pullover
exercises.description: A stretching movement that targets both the lats and chest
instructions: Lie across bench with shoulders on pad, hips unsupported
Hold dumbbell overhead with both hands, slight elbow bend
Lower weight behind head in an arc until you feel a deep lat stretch
Pull the weight back over your chest
tips: Keep hips low to maximize lat stretch
Maintain the same elbow angle throughout the movement
Focus on pulling with lats, not pressing with chest
avoid: Bending elbows more as the weight lowers
Raising hips to shorten the stretch

exercises.name: Barbell row
exercises.description: A compound pulling exercise for overall back development
instructions: Hinge at hips with soft knees; grip bar just outside shoulder width
Pull bar to lower chest or upper abdomen
Lower until arms are fully extended
tips: Keep torso angle constant; don't stand up as you row
Drive elbows past your torso at the top
Brace your core as if bracing for a punch
avoid: Heaving with lower back to start the pull
Letting torso rise excessively during the row

exercises.name: Deadlift
exercises.description: A fundamental compound lift that targets the entire posterior chain
instructions: Stand with bar over mid-foot; grip just outside knees
Set back flat, chest up, then drive through the floor
Stand tall with hips and knees locked
Reverse by hinging hips back first, then bending knees
tips: Squeeze lats to keep bar tight against body
Push the floor away rather than pulling the bar up
Take slack out of the bar before initiating the lift
avoid: Rounding the lower back at any point
Letting bar drift forward away from legs
Jerking the bar off the floor

exercises.name: Lat pulldown
exercises.description: A cable machine exercise targeting the latissimus dorsi
instructions: Sit with thighs secured; grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
Pull bar to upper chest while leaning back slightly
Return until arms are fully extended overhead
tips: Think about pulling your elbows into your back pockets
Puff chest out to meet the bar
Pause briefly at the bottom to feel lat contraction
avoid: Pulling bar behind the neck
Leaning back excessively to cheat weight down

exercises.name: Seated cable row
exercises.description: A cable rowing exercise for building back thickness
instructions: Sit with feet on platform, knees slightly bent; grip handle
Pull handle to lower chest, squeezing shoulder blades together
Return until arms extend and shoulders protract slightly
tips: Keep chest tall and proud throughout
Drive elbows straight back, not out to the sides
Allow a slight stretch forward at the start without rounding spine
avoid: Excessive torso rocking to generate momentum
Hunching shoulders forward at the extended position

exercises.name: Incline pike push-up
exercises.description: A beginner-friendly pike push-up with hands elevated to reduce load
instructions: Place hands on an elevated surface (bench, step, or sturdy chair)
Walk feet back and raise hips into an inverted V shape
Lower head toward the surface by bending elbows
Press back up to the starting position
tips: The higher the surface, the easier the exercise
Keep core tight and legs straight
Progress to lower surfaces as you get stronger
avoid: Letting hips sag during the movement
Using an unstable surface

exercises.name: Pike push-up
exercises.description: A push-up variation that targets the shoulders by creating a vertical pressing angle
instructions: Start in push-up position; walk hands back, raising hips into an inverted V
Lower your head toward the floor between your hands
Push back up to the starting position
tips: Keep legs as straight as possible to maximize shoulder angle
Position hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Look at your feet or between your hands, not forward
avoid: Letting hips drop during the pressing phase
Flaring elbows straight out to the sides

exercises.name: Handstand push-up
exercises.description: An advanced vertical pressing movement in a handstand position
instructions: Kick up into a handstand against a wall, hands shoulder-width plus
Lower until head gently touches the floor
Press back up to full arm extension
tips: Point fingers slightly outward for wrist comfort
Keep ribs stacked over hips; avoid banana-back arch
Push head through at the top for full lockout
avoid: Losing contact with the wall and falling off balance
Arching excessively to make the rep easier

exercises.name: Resistance band shoulder press
exercises.description: An overhead pressing movement using resistance bands
instructions: Stand on band center; hold handles at shoulder height
Press arms overhead until elbows lock out
Lower back to shoulder height
tips: Press straight up, not forward
Stack wrists directly over elbows at the start
Squeeze glutes to stabilize the torso
avoid: Leaning back to compensate for weak shoulders
Pressing the handles forward instead of overhead

exercises.name: Resistance band lateral raise
exercises.description: An isolation exercise for the side deltoids using bands
instructions: Stand on band; hold handles at sides with slight elbow bend
Raise arms out to the sides until parallel to floor
Lower with control
tips: Lead with elbows, not hands
Tilt pinkies slightly higher than thumbs at the top
Stop at shoulder height; going higher shifts load to traps
avoid: Shrugging shoulders toward ears
Bending elbows more as arms rise

exercises.name: Dumbbell shoulder press
exercises.description: A vertical pressing movement for shoulder development
instructions: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height, palms forward
Press overhead until arms fully extend
Lower to shoulder height
tips: Bring dumbbells slightly together at the top
Keep wrists stacked over elbows throughout
Sit with back supported to isolate shoulders more
avoid: Excessive lower back arch to cheat the weight up
Flaring elbows too far behind the torso

exercises.name: Dumbbell lateral raise
exercises.description: An isolation exercise targeting the side deltoids
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing in
Raise arms out to the sides until parallel to floor
Lower with control
tips: Lead with elbows, keeping them slightly higher than wrists
Tilt pinkies up as if pouring water from a pitcher
Use a weight that allows strict form for 10+ reps
avoid: Shrugging traps to lift heavier weight
Raising arms above shoulder level

exercises.name: Dumbbell front raise
exercises.description: An isolation exercise for the front deltoids
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at thighs, palms facing back
Raise arms forward to shoulder height
Lower with control
tips: Keep a slight bend in elbows throughout
Stop at shoulder height; higher shifts work to traps
Keep torso still; avoid swaying backward
avoid: Leaning back to swing weight up
Letting dumbbells drift inward toward midline

exercises.name: Dumbbell rear delt fly
exercises.description: An isolation exercise targeting the rear deltoids
instructions: Hinge forward until torso is near parallel to floor
Let dumbbells hang below chest with slight elbow bend
Raise arms out to sides, squeezing rear delts at top
Lower with control
tips: Keep torso angle constant; don't rise as you lift
Think about leading with elbows, not hands
Pause briefly at the top to feel rear delts contract
avoid: Rising up to make the lift easier
Pulling with traps instead of rear delts

exercises.name: Barbell overhead press
exercises.description: A compound overhead pressing movement for shoulder strength
instructions: Unrack bar at collarbone height, grip just outside shoulders
Press bar overhead, moving head back then forward as bar clears
Lock out with bar directly over mid-foot
Lower to collarbone
tips: Squeeze glutes and brace core before pressing
Shrug shoulders up into ears at lockout
Keep forearms vertical when viewed from the front
avoid: Excessive layback turning it into an incline press
Pressing the bar forward rather than straight up

exercises.name: Barbell upright row
exercises.description: A pulling movement targeting the shoulders and traps
instructions: Hold bar at thighs with shoulder-width or slightly wider grip
Pull bar up along body until upper arms are parallel to floor
Lower with control
tips: Lead with elbows, keeping them higher than wrists
Keep bar close to body throughout
Use a wider grip to reduce shoulder impingement risk
avoid: Pulling bar above upper chest level
Using a narrow grip if you have shoulder discomfort

exercises.name: Machine shoulder press
exercises.description: A guided overhead press using a machine for stability
instructions: Adjust seat so handles align with shoulders
Press handles overhead until arms fully extend
Lower to starting position
tips: Keep back pressed firmly against the pad
Press handles straight up, not forward
Focus on feeling deltoids work, not just pushing
avoid: Arching lower back away from pad
Stopping short of full lockout

exercises.name: Cable lateral raise
exercises.description: A lateral raise using cables for constant tension
instructions: Set pulley to lowest position; stand sideways to machine
Grab handle with far hand, arm across body
Raise arm out to side until parallel to floor
Lower with control
tips: Keep slight elbow bend locked throughout
Lead with elbow, not hand
Constant cable tension means no rest at bottom
avoid: Shrugging shoulder up during the raise
Raising arm above shoulder level

exercises.name: Bodyweight bicep curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl using your own body weight with a low bar or rings
instructions: Set bar at waist height; hang with supinated grip and body angled
Curl body up by bending only at the elbows
Lower until arms are fully extended
tips: Keep body rigid from head to heels
Only the elbow joint should move
Walk feet closer to bar to increase difficulty
avoid: Pulling with shoulders instead of curling with biceps
Letting hips pike or sag during the curl

exercises.name: Resistance band bicep curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl using resistance bands
instructions: Stand on band center; hold handles with palms up
Curl handles toward shoulders
Lower with control, keeping tension on band
tips: Pin elbows to sides throughout
Squeeze biceps hard at the top
Don't let band snap back; control the eccentric
avoid: Letting elbows drift forward as you curl
Using body swing to complete reps

exercises.name: Resistance band hammer curl
exercises.description: A hammer curl variation using resistance bands
instructions: Stand on band; hold handles with palms facing each other
Curl handles toward shoulders keeping neutral wrist
Lower with control
tips: Maintain neutral wrist angle throughout
Keep elbows pinned at your sides
Focus on brachialis squeeze at top
avoid: Rotating wrists during the movement
Swinging torso to complete reps

exercises.name: Dumbbell bicep curl
exercises.description: The classic bicep isolation exercise using dumbbells
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms forward
Curl weights toward shoulders
Lower to full arm extension
tips: Pin elbows at your sides; only forearms move
Supinate (rotate pinky up) as you curl for peak contraction
Squeeze hard at the top before lowering
avoid: Letting elbows drift forward or back
Swinging torso to heave weight up

exercises.name: Dumbbell hammer curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl with neutral grip targeting the brachialis
instructions: Stand with dumbbells at sides, palms facing each other
Curl weights toward shoulders keeping neutral grip
Lower with control
tips: Keep wrists locked in neutral; no rotation
Bring thumbs toward front delts at top
This grip emphasizes brachialis and forearms
avoid: Rotating wrists into supination during curl
Swinging body to complete reps

exercises.name: Dumbbell concentration curl
exercises.description: An isolation curl that eliminates momentum for strict bicep work
instructions: Sit with legs spread; brace elbow against inner thigh
Let dumbbell hang, then curl toward shoulder
Lower to full extension
tips: Keep upper arm locked against thigh; it shouldn't move
Twist pinky up at top for peak contraction
This eliminates all momentum; go lighter than regular curls
avoid: Lifting elbow off thigh to cheat the weight up
Leaning torso to assist the curl

exercises.name: Barbell curl
exercises.description: A bilateral bicep curl using a barbell
instructions: Stand holding bar with underhand grip, arms extended
Curl bar toward shoulders
Lower to full extension
tips: Keep elbows pinned at sides throughout
Squeeze biceps at top before lowering
An EZ bar reduces wrist strain if needed
avoid: Leaning back or swinging hips to curl heavier
Letting elbows drift forward during curl

exercises.name: Barbell preacher curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl using a preacher bench for strict isolation
instructions: Adjust bench so armpits rest on top of pad
Hold bar with arms extended on pad
Curl bar toward shoulders
Lower to near-full extension
tips: Keep upper arms pressed into pad throughout
Stop just short of lockout to maintain tension
The stretch at bottom is intense; control it
avoid: Lifting shoulders or chest off the pad
Hyperextending elbows at bottom

exercises.name: Cable bicep curl
exercises.description: A bicep curl using a cable machine for constant tension
instructions: Set pulley to lowest position; face machine and grip bar
Curl bar toward shoulders
Lower with control, maintaining cable tension
tips: Pin elbows at sides; they shouldn't move
Cables provide constant tension; no rest at bottom
Try straight bar, EZ bar, or rope for variety
avoid: Leaning back to cheat weight up
Letting elbows drift forward

exercises.name: Machine preacher curl
exercises.description: A machine-based preacher curl for guided bicep isolation
instructions: Adjust seat so armpits rest on pad top
Place upper arms on pad and grip handles
Curl handles toward shoulders
Lower to near-full extension
tips: Keep upper arms pressed into pad at all times
Stop short of lockout to maintain tension
Squeeze biceps hard at peak contraction
avoid: Lifting upper arms off the pad
Hyperextending elbows at bottom

exercises.name: Tricep dip
exercises.description: A compound pushing exercise targeting the triceps
instructions: Support yourself on parallel bars with arms locked out
Lower by bending elbows until upper arms are parallel to floor
Push back up to full arm extension
tips: Stay upright to emphasize triceps; lean forward for more chest
Keep elbows pointing back, not flared out
Lock out fully at the top of each rep
avoid: Descending too deep, stressing the shoulder capsule
Flaring elbows wide to the sides

exercises.name: Bench dip
exercises.description: A tricep dip variation using a bench for support
instructions: Place hands on bench edge behind you, fingers forward
Walk feet out and lower by bending elbows to 90 degrees
Push back up to full extension
tips: Keep back close to bench throughout
Extend legs straight for more difficulty; bend knees for less
Lock elbows fully at the top
avoid: Descending past 90 degrees, stressing shoulders
Letting body drift too far from the bench

exercises.name: Close-grip push-up
exercises.description: A push-up variation with hands close together emphasizing triceps
instructions: Start in push-up position with hands close together or forming a diamond
Lower chest toward hands, keeping elbows close to sides
Push back up to full extension
tips: Keep elbows tracking back along your ribs
Maintain rigid body from head to heels
The closer your hands, the more tricep emphasis
avoid: Flaring elbows out wide
Letting hips sag or pike up

exercises.name: Resistance band tricep pushdown
exercises.description: A tricep pushdown using resistance bands
instructions: Anchor band above head; grip with both hands, elbows at 90 degrees
Extend arms down until elbows lock out
Return to 90 degrees with control
tips: Pin elbows at your sides; only forearms move
Squeeze triceps hard at full extension
Don't let band snap back; control the return
avoid: Letting elbows drift forward during extension
Leaning excessively to help push down

exercises.name: Resistance band overhead tricep extension
exercises.description: An overhead tricep extension using resistance bands
instructions: Stand on band; hold other end overhead with elbows bent
Extend arms straight up
Lower behind head with control
tips: Keep elbows pointing forward and close to head
Upper arms should stay stationary; only forearms move
Overhead position stretches the long head of triceps
avoid: Flaring elbows out wide
Arching lower back to compensate

exercises.name: Dumbbell tricep kickback
exercises.description: An isolation exercise targeting the triceps with dumbbells
instructions: Hinge forward; hold dumbbell with elbow bent 90 degrees, upper arm parallel to floor
Extend arm back until straight
Return to 90 degrees
tips: Keep upper arm locked parallel to floor; only forearm moves
Squeeze tricep hard at full extension
Use lighter weight for strict form
avoid: Dropping the elbow as you extend
Swinging weight using body momentum

exercises.name: Dumbbell overhead tricep extension
exercises.description: An overhead extension for targeting the long head of the triceps
instructions: Hold one dumbbell overhead with both hands
Lower weight behind head by bending elbows
Extend arms back to start
tips: Keep elbows pointing up and close to head
Upper arms stay stationary; only forearms move
Feel the stretch at the bottom before extending
avoid: Flaring elbows out to the sides
Arching lower back as weight gets heavy

exercises.name: Dumbbell skull crusher
exercises.description: A lying tricep extension targeting all three heads
instructions: Lie on bench; hold dumbbells with arms extended over chest
Lower weights toward forehead by bending only at elbows
Extend back to start
tips: Keep upper arms vertical and stationary
Lower to forehead or just past for full stretch
Control the descent to protect elbow joints
avoid: Letting upper arms drift back during the movement
Flaring elbows wide

exercises.name: Barbell skull crusher
exercises.description: A lying tricep extension using a barbell
instructions: Lie on bench; hold bar with narrow grip, arms extended
Lower bar toward forehead by bending elbows
Extend arms to return to start
tips: Keep upper arms vertical throughout
Lower to forehead or just behind head for full stretch
An EZ bar reduces wrist strain
avoid: Flaring elbows out wide
Letting bar drift too far back, turning it into a pullover

exercises.name: Close-grip bench press
exercises.description: A bench press variation with narrow grip to emphasize triceps
instructions: Lie on bench; grip bar shoulder-width or slightly narrower
Lower bar to lower chest, keeping elbows close to sides
Press back up to full lockout
tips: Keep elbows tucked at about 30-45 degrees
Touch lower on chest than regular bench press
Don't go too narrow; shoulder-width is effective
avoid: Flaring elbows wide, which shifts work to chest
Grip so narrow it strains wrists

exercises.name: Cable tricep pushdown
exercises.description: A tricep isolation exercise using a cable machine
instructions: Set pulley high; face machine and grip bar or rope
Pin elbows at sides and push down until arms fully extend
Return to 90 degrees with control
tips: Keep elbows stationary throughout
Squeeze triceps at lockout
Try different attachments: straight bar, V-bar, rope
avoid: Letting elbows drift forward or back
Leaning into the push to use body weight

exercises.name: Cable overhead tricep extension
exercises.description: An overhead tricep extension using cables for constant tension
instructions: Set pulley low; face away and hold rope overhead
Start with elbows bent, hands behind head
Extend arms overhead, then return with control
tips: Keep upper arms vertical and stationary
Lean slightly forward for balance and stretch
Cable tension emphasizes the stretched position
avoid: Arching back excessively
Letting elbows flare wide

exercises.name: Bodyweight squat
exercises.description: A fundamental lower body exercise using body weight
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out
Push hips back and bend knees to lower down
Descend until thighs are parallel to floor or below
Drive through feet to return to standing
tips: Push knees out in the direction your toes point
Keep weight distributed across the whole foot
Initiate the movement by breaking at hips and knees simultaneously
avoid: Letting knees collapse inward (valgus)
Shifting weight onto toes and lifting heels
Excessive forward lean of the torso

exercises.name: Pistol squat
exercises.description: A single-leg squat requiring strength, balance, and mobility
instructions: Stand on one leg with the other leg extended forward
Lower by bending the standing leg while keeping the free leg elevated
Descend until the hamstring touches the calf
Drive through the standing foot to return upright
tips: Reach arms forward as a counterbalance
Keep the extended leg active and toes pulled back
Press the standing heel firmly into the ground
avoid: Letting the standing heel lift off the floor
Allowing the extended leg to drop and touch the ground
Collapsing the torso forward at the bottom

exercises.name: Jump squat
exercises.description: An explosive squat variation that builds power
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Lower into a squat until thighs are parallel
Explode upward, fully extending hips, knees, and ankles
Land softly and immediately descend into the next rep
tips: Absorb the landing through ankles, knees, and hips
Swing arms up during takeoff to add power
Reset your base on each landing before jumping again
avoid: Landing with stiff, locked-out legs
Performing shallow quarter-squats before jumping
Letting knees collapse inward on landing

exercises.name: Resistance band squat
exercises.description: A squat with added resistance from bands
instructions: Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width apart
Hold handles at shoulder height or loop band over shoulders
Squat down until thighs are parallel
Stand back up against the band's resistance
tips: Maintain band tension even at the bottom of the squat
Accelerate through the sticking point where band tension peaks
Keep elbows high if holding handles at shoulders
avoid: Letting the band go slack at the bottom position
Allowing handles to pull you forward into a rounded position
Stance too narrow, causing instability on the band

exercises.name: Resistance band leg extension
exercises.description: An isolation exercise for the quadriceps using bands
instructions: Sit in a chair with band anchored low behind you
Loop the band around the ankle of the working leg
Extend the knee until the leg is straight
Return under control to the starting position
tips: Keep the thigh pressed firmly against the seat
Squeeze the quad hard at full lockout
Point the toe up (dorsiflex) to increase quad engagement
avoid: Lifting the thigh off the seat during extension
Letting the band snap back uncontrolled
Hyperextending the knee at the top

exercises.name: Dumbbell goblet squat
exercises.description: A front-loaded squat variation ideal for learning squat mechanics
instructions: Hold a dumbbell vertically at chest height, cupping the top end
Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width
Squat down, keeping the dumbbell close to your chest
Drive through your feet to return to standing
tips: Let elbows track inside your knees at the bottom
Use the weight as a counterbalance to sit back deeper
Keep the dumbbell vertical and close to your body
avoid: Letting the dumbbell drift forward away from the chest
Rounding the upper back as you descend
Rising onto toes due to the front load

exercises.name: Dumbbell lunge
exercises.description: A unilateral leg exercise for building leg strength and balance
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides
Step forward and lower until the back knee nearly touches the floor
Keep the front heel planted throughout the descent
Push through the front foot to return to standing
tips: Take a long enough step that both knees reach 90 degrees
Keep the torso upright, not leaning forward
Drive through the heel, not the ball of the front foot
avoid: Taking too short a step, causing the front knee to track too far forward
Letting the back knee slam into the ground
Wobbling side to side due to narrow stance width

exercises.name: Dumbbell step-up
exercises.description: A step-up exercise with added dumbbell resistance
instructions: Stand facing a bench or platform, holding dumbbells at your sides
Place one foot fully on the platform
Drive through that foot to stand up on the platform
Step back down with control, leading with the same leg
tips: Lean slightly forward to keep tension on the working leg
Avoid pushing off with the trailing foot on the ground
Place the entire foot on the box, not just the toes
avoid: Using the back leg to push off the floor
Letting the knee of the stepping leg cave inward
Bouncing off the platform instead of controlling each rep

exercises.name: Barbell back squat
exercises.description: The king of lower body exercises for building strength and mass
instructions: Position the bar on your upper back (high bar) or rear delts (low bar)
Unrack and step back with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down until thighs are at least parallel to the floor
Drive through your feet to return to standing
tips: Brace your core hard before each rep
Push knees out in the direction your toes point
Keep the bar path vertical over mid-foot
avoid: Letting hips shoot up first (good-morning squat)
Knees caving inward, especially out of the hole
Excessive forward lean causing the bar to drift forward

exercises.name: Barbell front squat
exercises.description: A squat variation with the bar in front, emphasizing quadriceps
instructions: Position the bar on front deltoids with elbows high
Unrack and step back with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down while maintaining an upright torso
Drive through your feet to return to standing
tips: Keep elbows as high as possible throughout the lift
Only fingertips need to touch the bar in a clean grip
Push knees forward to stay upright and hit depth
avoid: Letting elbows drop, causing the bar to roll forward
Leaning forward excessively and dumping the bar
Wrist pain from trying to hold the bar with a full grip

exercises.name: Leg press
exercises.description: A machine-based pressing movement for the legs
instructions: Sit in the leg press with feet shoulder-width apart on the platform
Release the safety and lower the platform toward your chest
Lower until legs reach approximately 90 degrees at the knee
Press the platform back up without fully locking out
tips: Keep your lower back pressed flat against the pad
Place feet higher on the platform to emphasize glutes
Place feet lower on the platform to emphasize quads
avoid: Letting the lower back round and lift off the pad
Locking knees hard at the top of each rep
Bouncing out of the bottom position

exercises.name: Leg extension
exercises.description: An isolation exercise for the quadriceps
instructions: Adjust the machine so the pad sits on the lower shins
Sit with your back against the pad and grip the handles
Extend your legs until they are straight
Lower with control to the starting position
tips: Squeeze the quads hard at full lockout
Point toes up (dorsiflex) to increase rectus femoris activation
Pause briefly at the top to eliminate momentum
avoid: Lifting hips or butt off the seat
Using a jerky, swinging motion to lift the weight
Hyperextending the knees at the top

exercises.name: Nordic curl
exercises.description: An advanced bodyweight exercise for hamstring strength
instructions: Kneel on a pad with ankles secured under a sturdy object
Keep your body in a straight line from knees to head
Lower yourself forward by extending at the knees
Pull yourself back up using your hamstrings
tips: Maintain a straight line from knee to shoulder throughout
Squeeze glutes to prevent hip flexion
Lower only as far as you can control on the way back up
avoid: Breaking at the hips and bending forward
Falling forward uncontrollably without braking
Letting the hips pike up during the ascent

exercises.name: Glute-ham raise
exercises.description: A challenging bodyweight exercise for the posterior chain
instructions: Set up on a GHD machine with feet secured and knees on the pad
Start with torso perpendicular to the floor
Lower your torso forward by extending the knees
Curl back up by flexing the knees and squeezing glutes
tips: Keep hips fully extended throughout the movement
Push toes into the footplate to engage hamstrings better
Think of pulling your heels toward your glutes
avoid: Bending at the hips instead of staying extended
Using excessive hip flexion to cheat the curl
Hyperextending the lower back at the top

exercises.name: Resistance band leg curl
exercises.description: A hamstring curl using resistance bands
instructions: Anchor the band to a low fixed point
Lie face down with the band looped around your ankles
Curl your heels toward your glutes
Lower under control to the starting position
tips: Press hips firmly into the floor throughout
Squeeze the hamstrings hard at peak contraction
Point toes away from you to bias the hamstrings over calves
avoid: Lifting hips off the ground as you curl
Letting the band snap your legs back down
Stopping short before reaching full knee flexion

exercises.name: Resistance band good morning
exercises.description: A hip hinge exercise using resistance bands
instructions: Stand on the band with feet hip-width apart
Loop the band behind your neck and over your shoulders
Hinge at the hips, pushing your butt back
Return to standing by driving hips forward
tips: Keep a slight bend in the knees but don't squat
Push hips back rather than bending the torso forward
Maintain a neutral spine from head to tailbone
avoid: Rounding the lower back under load
Squatting down instead of hinging
Letting the band pull your head and neck forward

exercises.name: Dumbbell Romanian deadlift
exercises.description: A hip hinge exercise targeting the hamstrings and glutes
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells in front of your thighs
Hinge at the hips, pushing your butt back with a slight knee bend
Lower the weights along your legs until you feel a hamstring stretch
Drive hips forward to return to standing
tips: Keep the dumbbells sliding along your legs throughout
Descend only as far as your hamstring flexibility allows
Squeeze glutes hard at the top to complete hip extension
avoid: Rounding the lower back as you descend
Bending the knees excessively, turning it into a squat
Letting the dumbbells drift away from your body

exercises.name: Dumbbell single-leg Romanian deadlift
exercises.description: A unilateral hip hinge for balance and hamstring development
instructions: Stand on one leg holding a dumbbell in the opposite hand
Hinge at the hip, extending the free leg behind you
Lower until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor
Drive the hip forward to return to standing
tips: Keep hips square to the ground, don't let the back hip open
Move the torso and back leg as one rigid unit
Keep a soft bend in the standing knee
avoid: Rotating the pelvis open to the side
Rounding the lower back as you reach down
Letting the back leg drop instead of extending it

exercises.name: Barbell Romanian deadlift
exercises.description: A barbell hip hinge for posterior chain development
instructions: Stand holding a barbell at hip level with an overhand grip
Hinge at the hips, pushing your butt back with a slight knee bend
Lower the bar along your legs until hamstrings are stretched
Drive hips forward to return to standing
tips: Keep the bar in contact with your legs throughout
Pull your shoulders back to prevent upper back rounding
Stop the descent when your back begins to round
avoid: Letting the bar drift forward away from your body
Rounding the lower back to reach the floor
Bending the knees so much it becomes a squat

exercises.name: Barbell good morning
exercises.description: A hip hinge with bar on back for hamstring and lower back strength
instructions: Position the bar on your upper back as in a squat
Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hinge at the hips, pushing your butt back until torso is near parallel
Drive hips forward to return upright
tips: Keep a slight knee bend but don't squat down
Push hips back rather than bending the torso forward
Maintain tension in your lats to stabilize the bar
avoid: Rounding the lower back under load
Descending too far beyond your hamstring flexibility
Letting the bar roll up toward your neck

exercises.name: Lying leg curl
exercises.description: A machine-based isolation exercise for the hamstrings
instructions: Lie face down on the machine with the pad on your lower calves
Grip the handles and press your hips into the pad
Curl your heels toward your glutes
Lower under control to the starting position
tips: Keep hips pressed firmly into the pad throughout
Point toes away (plantarflex) to reduce calf involvement
Squeeze hard at peak contraction before lowering
avoid: Lifting hips off the pad during the curl
Arching the lower back excessively
Stopping short of full knee flexion

exercises.name: Seated leg curl
exercises.description: A seated variation of the leg curl for hamstring isolation
instructions: Sit in the machine with the pad on your lower calves and thighs secured
Start with legs extended in front of you
Curl your heels under the seat by flexing the knees
Return under control to the starting position
tips: Keep your back pressed firmly against the seat pad
Point toes away to emphasize hamstrings over calves
Pause briefly at peak contraction before extending
avoid: Leaning forward or lifting off the seat
Stopping short of full knee flexion
Letting the weight stack slam between reps

exercises.name: Glute bridge
exercises.description: A fundamental glute activation and strengthening exercise
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor
Drive through your heels to lift hips toward the ceiling
Squeeze glutes hard at the top
Lower with control to the starting position
tips: Push through your heels, keeping toes relaxed or lifted
Stop when your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees
Maintain a neutral spine; don't arch the lower back
avoid: Pushing through the balls of your feet instead of heels
Hyperextending the lower back at the top
Letting knees cave inward during the lift

exercises.name: Single-leg glute bridge
exercises.description: A unilateral glute bridge for addressing imbalances
instructions: Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended
Drive through the planted heel to lift your hips
Keep hips level throughout the movement
Lower with control and repeat on the same side
tips: Keep hips square; don't let the free side drop
Push through the heel of the planted foot
Squeeze the working glute hard at the top
avoid: Letting the pelvis rotate or tilt toward the extended leg
Using lower back extension instead of glute contraction
Dropping the hip of the extended leg below level

exercises.name: Fire hydrant
exercises.description: A hip abduction exercise targeting the gluteus medius
instructions: Start on hands and knees in a tabletop position
Keeping the knee bent at 90 degrees, lift one leg out to the side
Raise until the thigh is parallel to the floor
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep hips level and square to the floor
Initiate the lift from the glute, not by shifting your body
Maintain a flat back and engaged core throughout
avoid: Rotating the hips or torso during the lift
Leaning away from the working leg to lift higher
Arching or rounding the lower back

exercises.name: Resistance band glute bridge
exercises.description: A glute bridge with band around thighs for added resistance
instructions: Place a band around your thighs just above the knees
Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor
Press knees out against the band while bridging up
Squeeze glutes at the top, then lower with control
tips: Maintain outward knee pressure against the band throughout
Drive through heels to maximize glute activation
Keep tension in the band even at the bottom of the rep
avoid: Letting knees cave inward as you lift or lower
Losing band tension at any point in the movement
Hyperextending the lower back at lockout

exercises.name: Resistance band clamshell
exercises.description: A hip abduction exercise targeting the gluteus medius
instructions: Lie on your side with a band around your thighs above the knees
Keep feet together and knees bent at 90 degrees
Raise the top knee up while keeping your feet pressed together
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Stack your hips vertically; don't let the top hip roll back
Initiate the movement from the glute, not by rotating the pelvis
Keep feet firmly pressed together throughout
avoid: Rolling the hips backward to lift the knee higher
Separating the feet during the movement
Using hip flexors by pulling the knee toward the chest

exercises.name: Dumbbell hip thrust
exercises.description: A weighted hip thrust for glute development
instructions: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench, dumbbell on hips
Plant feet flat and drive through your heels to lift hips
At the top, shoulders, hips, and knees form a straight line
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Tuck your chin and look forward, not up at the ceiling
Position feet so shins are vertical at the top
Squeeze glutes hard at lockout before lowering
avoid: Hyperextending the lower back by pushing too high
Placing feet too close or too far from the body
Looking up, which can cause neck strain and excessive back arch

exercises.name: Dumbbell sumo squat
exercises.description: A wide-stance squat emphasizing the glutes and inner thighs
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed out 30-45 degrees
Hold a dumbbell hanging between your legs with both hands
Squat down, keeping your chest up and knees tracking over toes
Drive through your heels to stand back up
tips: Push knees out actively in the direction of your toes
Keep torso as upright as possible throughout
Descend until thighs are at least parallel to the floor
avoid: Letting knees cave inward on the way up
Leaning the torso forward excessively
Rising onto toes instead of driving through heels

exercises.name: Barbell hip thrust
exercises.description: A heavy compound movement for maximum glute development
instructions: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench, barbell over hips
Use a bar pad for comfort
Drive through your heels to lift hips until thighs are parallel to floor
Squeeze glutes at the top, then lower with control
tips: Keep chin tucked and ribs down to prevent back hyperextension
Position feet so shins are vertical at lockout
Pause and squeeze hard at the top of each rep
avoid: Hyperextending the lower back by thrusting too high
Looking up at the ceiling, which encourages back arching
Placing feet too far forward, which shifts work to hamstrings

exercises.name: Barbell sumo deadlift
exercises.description: A wide-stance deadlift variation emphasizing the glutes
instructions: Stand with feet wide, toes pointed out, bar over mid-foot
Grip the bar inside your legs with arms straight down
Drive through the floor, pushing knees out, while keeping chest up
Stand fully upright, then lower the bar under control
tips: Push knees out hard into your arms throughout the lift
Keep chest proud and shoulders over or slightly behind the bar
Lock out by driving hips through while squeezing glutes
avoid: Letting knees cave inward, especially off the floor
Shooting hips up first, turning it into a stiff-leg pull
Rounding the lower back at the start or during the lift

exercises.name: Hip abduction machine
exercises.description: A machine exercise targeting the outer glutes
instructions: Sit in the machine with legs together and pads on outer thighs
Push your legs apart against the resistance
Squeeze hard at the widest point
Return with control to the starting position
tips: Lean forward slightly to emphasize gluteus maximus
Pause and squeeze at full abduction on each rep
Keep your back flat against the pad or lean forward consistently
avoid: Jerking the weight open with a big push
Leaning back excessively, which reduces glute engagement
Letting the weight stack crash between reps

exercises.name: Cable kickback
exercises.description: A cable exercise for isolating the glutes
instructions: Attach an ankle strap to a low cable pulley
Face the machine and hold on for support
Kick the working leg straight back, keeping it nearly straight
Squeeze the glute at the top, then return with control
tips: Keep a slight bend in the standing leg for stability
Focus on driving through the heel of the working leg
Limit the range to what your glute can control, not your back
avoid: Arching the lower back to kick the leg higher
Rotating the hips open during the kick
Bending the working knee excessively, turning it into a hamstring curl

exercises.name: Standing calf raise
exercises.description: A basic calf raise using body weight
instructions: Stand on the edge of a step with heels hanging off
Rise up onto your toes as high as possible
Squeeze the calves at the top
Lower heels below the step level for a deep stretch
tips: Pause at the top for a 1-2 second squeeze
Lower the heels as far as flexibility allows for a full stretch
Keep legs straight but not hyperextended
avoid: Bouncing at the bottom to use momentum
Bending the knees during the movement
Cutting the range short at either the top or bottom

exercises.name: Single-leg calf raise
exercises.description: A unilateral calf raise for balanced development
instructions: Stand on one leg on the edge of a step
Rise up onto your toes as high as possible
Lower the heel below the step for a full stretch
Complete all reps on one leg before switching
tips: Lightly touch a wall or railing for balance only, not support
Lower the heel slowly to maximize the eccentric stretch
Keep the knee of the working leg straight
avoid: Using the wall or railing to push yourself up
Allowing the knee to bend during the movement
Rushing through reps without pausing at the top

exercises.name: Resistance band calf raise
exercises.description: A calf raise with band resistance
instructions: Stand on the band with the balls of your feet, holding the ends
Rise up onto your toes against the band resistance
Squeeze the calves at the top
Lower under control to the starting position
tips: Hold handles at shoulder height to keep tension consistent
Pause and squeeze hard at the top of each rep
Keep your torso upright, not leaning into the band
avoid: Letting the band go slack at any point
Leaning forward to reduce band tension
Bending the knees to cheat the movement

exercises.name: Seated resistance band calf raise
exercises.description: A seated calf raise targeting the soleus muscle
instructions: Sit on a bench or chair with feet flat on the floor
Loop the band under the balls of your feet and hold the ends
Push through your toes to raise your heels against the band
Lower under control to the starting position
tips: Keep your knees at 90 degrees throughout the movement
Pull the band taut before starting to maintain constant tension
Focus on the squeeze at the top of each rep
avoid: Letting the band go slack at the bottom of the rep
Straightening the legs to reduce resistance
Rocking the torso to generate momentum

exercises.name: Dumbbell calf raise
exercises.description: A weighted standing calf raise using dumbbells
instructions: Stand on the edge of a platform with heels hanging off
Hold a dumbbell in one hand, use the other for balance
Rise up onto your toes as high as possible
Lower heels below the platform for a full stretch
tips: Switch the dumbbell hand each set for balanced grip work
Pause at the top for a hard squeeze before lowering
Let heels drop as low as possible for a deep stretch
avoid: Bouncing at the bottom to use the stretch reflex
Bending knees to recruit quad assistance
Leaning into the support hand for lift assistance

exercises.name: Dumbbell seated calf raise
exercises.description: A seated calf raise with dumbbells on knees
instructions: Sit on a bench with the balls of your feet on a platform or block
Rest dumbbells on your lower thighs near the knees
Raise your heels by pushing through your toes
Lower heels below the platform for a full stretch
tips: Place a pad or towel under the dumbbells for comfort
Keep the weight centered over the knee, not sliding forward
Use a platform high enough to allow a full stretch at the bottom
avoid: Letting the dumbbells roll toward the hip
Using a platform too low to allow full heel drop
Leaning back, which shifts stress off the calves

exercises.name: Barbell calf raise
exercises.description: A standing calf raise using a barbell on the back
instructions: Position a barbell on your upper back as in a squat
Stand on a raised surface with heels hanging off
Rise up onto your toes as high as possible
Lower heels below the platform for a full stretch
tips: Keep your core braced to stabilize the bar
Maintain an upright torso; don't lean forward or back
Pause at the top for a hard contraction
avoid: Letting the bar shift forward or backward on your back
Leaning the torso to generate momentum
Bouncing at the bottom of the rep

exercises.name: Standing calf raise machine
exercises.description: A machine-based standing calf raise
instructions: Position shoulders under the pads, balls of feet on the platform
Stand up to release the weight
Rise onto your toes as high as possible
Lower heels below the platform for a full stretch
tips: Keep a soft bend in the knees to protect the joint
Pause and squeeze at the top of each rep
Let heels drop as low as possible at the bottom
avoid: Locking the knees completely
Bouncing out of the bottom position
Leaning forward into the shoulder pads

exercises.name: Seated calf raise machine
exercises.description: A machine-based seated calf raise targeting the soleus
instructions: Sit with the balls of your feet on the platform and knees under the pad
Release the safety and lower your heels for a stretch
Raise your heels as high as possible by pushing through your toes
Lower under control for a full stretch
tips: Adjust the knee pad so it sits snugly on your lower thighs
Pause at the top and squeeze before lowering
Let heels drop fully at the bottom for maximum stretch
avoid: Setting the knee pad too high, reducing resistance
Bouncing at the bottom to use the stretch reflex
Stopping short of full heel drop or full contraction

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.description: A fundamental isometric core exercise
instructions: Start on forearms and toes with elbows directly under shoulders
Create a straight line from head to heels
Brace core and squeeze glutes
Hold the position for the prescribed time
tips: Tuck your pelvis slightly to engage lower abs
Actively push the floor away through your forearms
Keep your neck neutral by looking at a spot between your hands
avoid: Letting hips sag toward the floor
Piking hips up to reduce tension
Craning the neck up to look forward

exercises.name: Dead bug
exercises.description: An anti-extension core exercise for stability
instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling
Lift legs with knees bent at 90 degrees
Lower the opposite arm and leg toward the floor simultaneously
Return to the start and repeat on the other side
tips: Press your lower back firmly into the floor throughout
Exhale as you extend the limbs to maintain core tension
Only lower limbs as far as you can while keeping lower back flat
avoid: Letting the lower back arch off the floor
Holding your breath during the movement
Extending limbs too fast, losing core control

exercises.name: Bicycle crunch
exercises.description: A dynamic crunch variation targeting obliques
instructions: Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs lifted
Bring one knee toward your chest while extending the other leg
Rotate your torso, bringing the opposite elbow toward the bent knee
Alternate sides in a smooth pedaling motion
tips: Focus on rotating the ribcage, not just touching elbow to knee
Keep your lower back pressed into the floor
Lightly support your head; don't pull on your neck
avoid: Yanking the head forward with your hands
Letting the extended leg drop too close to the floor
Rushing through reps without fully rotating

exercises.name: Mountain climber
exercises.description: A dynamic core exercise that also elevates heart rate
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders
Drive one knee toward your chest
Quickly switch legs in a running motion
Keep hips low and level throughout
tips: Maintain a flat back; don't let hips rise
Drive knees toward the outside of the elbows for more oblique work
Keep shoulders stacked over wrists
avoid: Letting hips pike up or bounce up and down
Shifting weight too far back toward the feet
Stopping the knee short of the chest

exercises.name: Hanging leg raise
exercises.description: An advanced core exercise hanging from a bar
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with arms fully extended
Keep legs straight and together
Raise legs until parallel to the floor or higher
Lower with control to the starting position
tips: Initiate the movement by curling the pelvis up, not just lifting legs
Pause at the top to maximize ab contraction
Keep shoulders pulled down away from ears
avoid: Swinging or kipping to generate momentum
Bending the knees to make the lift easier (unless intentional)
Dropping legs quickly on the descent

exercises.name: Resistance band Pallof press
exercises.description: An anti-rotation core exercise using bands
instructions: Anchor the band at chest height and hold it with both hands at your chest
Stand perpendicular to the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart
Press your hands straight out from your chest
Hold briefly, resisting rotation, then return hands to chest
tips: Keep hips and shoulders square; don't let the band twist you
Squeeze your glutes and brace your core before pressing
Stand far enough from the anchor to create significant tension
avoid: Allowing the torso or hips to rotate toward the anchor
Standing too close to the anchor, reducing resistance
Letting the arms drift toward the band rather than pressing straight

exercises.name: Resistance band woodchop
exercises.description: A rotational core exercise using resistance bands
instructions: Anchor the band high or low on one side
Hold the handle with both hands, arms extended
Rotate your torso diagonally across your body
Return under control to the starting position
tips: Rotate through your hips and core, not just your arms
Keep arms relatively straight to act as a lever
Pivot on the back foot to allow full hip rotation
avoid: Moving only your arms without rotating the torso
Letting the band snap you back without controlling the return
Rounding the back during the chop motion

exercises.name: Dumbbell side bend
exercises.description: A lateral flexion exercise for the obliques
instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in one hand at your side
Place the opposite hand behind your head
Bend sideways toward the weighted side, lowering the dumbbell
Return to upright by contracting the opposite oblique
tips: Move directly in the lateral plane; don't lean forward or back
Use only one dumbbell to create imbalance for the obliques
Focus on the stretch at the bottom and contraction at the top
avoid: Leaning forward or backward during the bend
Holding dumbbells in both hands, which cancels out the resistance
Bending at the hips instead of the spine

exercises.name: Dumbbell Russian twist
exercises.description: A rotational core exercise holding a dumbbell
instructions: Sit with knees bent and feet flat on the floor or lifted
Lean back slightly while holding a dumbbell with both hands
Rotate your torso side to side, touching the dumbbell to the floor each side
Keep core braced and chest up throughout
tips: Lift feet off the floor to increase difficulty
Rotate your entire ribcage, not just your arms
Keep your back straight; don't round or hyperextend
avoid: Swinging the arms without rotating the torso
Rounding the upper or lower back
Letting the dumbbell do the work by swinging momentum

exercises.name: Barbell rollout
exercises.description: An advanced anti-extension core exercise
instructions: Kneel behind a loaded barbell with hands shoulder-width apart on the bar
Roll the bar forward, extending your body toward the floor
Keep your core braced and hips extended
Use your core to pull the bar back to the starting position
tips: Squeeze glutes throughout to prevent lower back arching
Only roll out as far as you can control on the return
Tuck your chin slightly to maintain a neutral spine
avoid: Letting the lower back arch as you extend
Going too far forward and collapsing
Using arm strength instead of core to pull back

exercises.name: Cable crunch
exercises.description: A weighted crunch using a cable machine
instructions: Kneel facing the cable machine with a rope attachment overhead
Hold the rope at the sides of your head
Crunch down by flexing your spine, bringing elbows toward your thighs
Return with control to the starting position
tips: Focus on curling your spine, not hinging at the hips
Keep your arms fixed; don't pull the rope down with your hands
Exhale forcefully as you crunch for maximum ab engagement
avoid: Pulling the rope down with arm strength
Sitting back onto your heels instead of crunching
Letting the weight jerk you back up on the return

exercises.name: Cable woodchop
exercises.description: A rotational core exercise using a cable machine
instructions: Set the cable high or low and stand sideways to the machine
Hold the handle with both hands and arms extended
Rotate your torso diagonally across your body
Return with control to the starting position
tips: Rotate through your hips and core, not just your shoulders
Keep arms straight to maximize rotational lever arm
Pivot on the back foot to allow full hip rotation
avoid: Moving only the arms without rotating the torso
Letting the cable yank you back on the return
Rounding or hyperextending the spine during rotation
